p: The most prominent toxic effect of D. viscosa on zebrafish embryos (with almost all the extracts) was egg coagulation or mortality within few hours of exposure. 100% of treated embryos died within 6 hours of exposure at concentration in microgram range. The most toxic extract was hexane fraction which induced 100% mortality in treated embryos ≤0.7 µg/mL followed by the crude extract where 100% mortality was observed with concentration ≤1.00 µg/mL.
